intro: Achrouteria durifructa, commonly known as the hard-fruited achrouteria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a hard, woody capsule that contains several seeds. Achrouteria durifructa is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in coastal or mountainous habitats.
